content:
Your solution has exponential complexity, therefore is not adequate for such dimensions.

Validation code TLE on 
30
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcd
bcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcde
cdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdef
defghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefg
efghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefgh
fghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghi
ghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghij
hijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijk
ijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijkl
jklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklm
klmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmn
lmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmno
mnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnop
nopqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopq
opqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqr
pqrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrs
qrstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrst
rstuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstu
stuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuv
tuvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvw
uvwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwx
vwxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxy
wxyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyy
xyyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyya
yyabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyab
zabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzabc
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcd
bcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcde
cdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdef
defghijklmnopqrstuvwxyyabcdefg

Either provides a correct validation code that would handle all possible testcases within the contraints you defined, or change the constraints

And don't try to change your exploration order, it will not cover some other cases I can still find.
IMO It would have been interesting to allow for multiple matches.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It took me about 20 minutes to figure it out. I think that it is almost impossible if it is the time of clash of code. So I approve.nice game.
could be a clash of code too

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice easy puzzle. The statement is clear and the level well chosen.

When solving your puzzle i have noticed that there is only one string which is solution in all test cases so you should remove the "s"  at the end of the word "string" here:  "In other words, this problem only displays the consecutive strings" by "In other words, this problem only displays the consecutive string" and here:  "As above, only strings alphabetically from a to z should be displayed" by "As above, only the string alphabetically from a to z should be displayed".
Clever puzzle, I like the new output requirements, but IMO the statement needs a bit of rewriting.

Since binary output is generally frowned upon, you'll have to come up with some other idea to prevent this. Among others (maybe just one will suffice):

- If the answer is 'No', how far did we get, i.e. what was the length of the longest chain.
- If the answer is 'No', could we have done some substitution (maybe you could give the upper bound of substitutions allowed in the input) in the grid to turn this into 'Yes'.

- If the answer is 'Yes', print some ascii of the solution. It may be sth like this:
..........
abc.......
fedop.....
glmnqrsz..
hk...uty..
ij...vwx..
..........
..........
..........
..........

or this

..........
S-\.......
/-//\.....
|/-/\-\E..
||...//|..
\/...\-/..
..........
..........
..........
..........

It doesn't render well but you get the idea. 

Anyway, those aren't probably the most exciting suggestions, but you get the point, "Yes" and "No" puzzles should be avoided.

Thank you.
I didn't know that binary output was frowned upon, so I learned a lot.
I hope to make a correction tomorrow or the next day or something in the near future.
So far, I have read your comment and will reply. Thanks.

Thank you.
I fixed the description.
I changed it to try to make it as clear as possible what the output is.

Thank you.
I fixed the description.
Thank you.
Thank you.

Thank you.
Indeed. This program problem finds out only one the consecutive string  from a to z in alphabetical order, so Its difficulty might suitable for a Clash of Code.
However, I have about a week left for approval terms, so I would like to wait and see what results at the classic puzzle will be.
If it is not approved, I would prefer to reapply with Clash of Code. Thanks.
Thank you.

Sorry for the late reply.
Thank you for your advice.
Yes. It's just as you said.
Since it is easy mode, I thought only one sentence would be just fine, but I think multiple sentences would have been more interesting.
Since this game has already been approved and it seems that some people have already solved it, I'll stop modifying the answer of the program problem, however next time I make a problem, I'll think about making it more interesting.
Thanks.

Thanks for letting me know.
I have changed the constraints.
TBH it would have been way too long for a CoC, which require problems that can be solved under 5 minutes. That's a nice puzzle tho!
Thank you.

It is explicitly mentioned in the contribution guidelines that binary output should be avoided in a clash of code:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

While I don't think it's an issue for non-clash puzzles, in my opinion it's not very interesting to output answers of the type Yes/No, True/False, etc. So, yeah, better to change it.

Also, the constraint "There are multiple lowercase alphabets present" doesn't appear necessary and may be deleted.

Thanks.

Ah so it's really just enforced for CoC, then my bad, I didn't know that, I just assumed it was like that for every mode. Well then @renzyGo, please take the previous suggestion as nothing more than a personal opinion.

Thank you, @5DN1L.
I have read  in the contribution guidelines.
I want to be careful about binary output.
I have delete part of the constarints statement.thanks.

Thank you, @Rafarafa.
I have changed the program problem.
I wanted to make the output difficult, but I was not competent enough.
I feel like the program problem was made easier, so I feel like it is now for CoC.
